results.title: Hyper-Ballad
results.creator_credit: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Firas Massouh’s hunger for travel was started by his father who, as a communist activist, moved to Russia from Syria where he met his wife. With baby in tow, the family began a lifelong journey of travelling, which was continued by Firas when he decided to continue his father’s travels and move to Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Firas Massouh, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Tripoli Melbourne & Me!
results.creator_credit: Dania Dabliz, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dania Dabliz’s life in Tripoli was full of fun, friends and parties. When she migrated to Melbourne she wondered if she would find the same things again?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dania Dabliz, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Loving Lebanon and Australia
results.creator_credit: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Haddad, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: When Lebanese immigrant Sam Haddad migrated to Australia he encountered ignorance and racism but via a well timed punch, he learned the value of mateship and tolerance and began to love his adopted country.

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Churchill Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.

results.title: Is it always right to be right?
results.creator_credit: Lee Mishkin, Nick Bosustow and Stephen Bosustow Productions
results.brief_description: This fast moving parable, designed to provoke discussion without alienating any group, highlights the centres of divisiveness in our society, the generation gap, poverty, war and race. It tells of a land “where men were always right”. This animated film is a winner of many awards including an Academy Award. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.title: A Hundred-Odd Years From Now
results.creator_credit: Fred Schepisi, Australian Dried Fruits Association and Film House Company
results.brief_description: An advertising film with a difference: Into a strange computerised future where women “run things” by controlling huge colourful computers that go bleep booble bob bob ping etc, comes Yockoo, the boy from the bush, with his satchel of dried fruits. Slowly the women overcome their cold, futuristic ways in light of Yockoo’s size, shape and overall manliness. Eventually they unearth their deep feminine sexuality and cook Yockoo a feast of dried fruit dishes using cooking utensils from their local museum. Music by Frank Smith, Photographed by Lars Gundlach, Written and designed by Weatherhead & Stitt.

results.title: The Cave: a parable told by Orson Welles
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
results.brief_description: An animated dramatization based on “The Allegory of the Cave” from Book 7 of Plato’s “Republic” illustrating mankind’s escape from the world of illusion to the world of reality. Four men chained in a cave take images reflected on a wall for the truth. Narrated by Orson Welles.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow and Counterpoint Films
